Legal_Issue: Whether the trademark 'Cordon Bleu' was used in association with the services mentioned in its registration
Evidence_Assessment: Use of 'Cordon Bleu' on product labels with recipes and instructions was considered sufficient evidence of use
Burden_of_Proof: On the respondent to demonstrate use of the trademark under Section 45
Legal_Rule: Under Section 45 of the Trade-marks Act, a trademark must be shown to be in use in Canada for it to remain registered
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, as applicable to administrative review by the Federal Court
Procedural_Issue: Compliance with notice and evidence requirements under Section 45
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged lack of use of the trademark 'Cordon Bleu' in connection with registered services
Outcome_on_Merits: The claim challenging the registration failed
Review_Standard: Interpretation and application of Section 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Registrar issued notice; respondent had opportunity to provide evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Product labels bearing the mark 'Cordon Bleu' with recipes and instructions
Legal_Framework: Canadian trademark law, specifically Section 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Applicant_Challenge: Validity of the 'Cordon Bleu' trademark due to non-use
Defendant_Response: Provided evidence of trademark use on product labels
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative review under Section 45 followed by judicial appeal
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-use of trademark in relation to registered services
